title: Introduction to REST APIs
content: REST APIs allow different systems to communicate over HTTP using standard methods like GET and POST.

title: Understanding HTTP Methods
content: HTTP methods define actions such as retrieving data, creating records, updating resources, and deleting them.

title: What is a GET Request
content: A GET request is used to fetch data from a server without modifying the resource.

title: What is a POST Request
content: A POST request sends data to the server to create a new resource.

title: API Status Codes
content: Status codes like 200, 201, 400, and 500 indicate the result of an API request.

title: JSON as Data Format
content: JSON is a lightweight data format commonly used in APIs for sending and receiving data.

title: Middleware in Express
content: Middleware functions process requests before they reach the route handler.

title: Database Integration
content: APIs often connect to databases to store and retrieve application data.

title: Authentication Basics
content: Authentication ensures that only authorized users can access protected API endpoints.

title: Error Handling in APIs
content: Proper error handling improves API reliability and helps developers debug issues.

title: Pagination in APIs
content: Pagination limits the number of records returned in a single API response to improve performance.

title: Filtering and Sorting Data
content: APIs can support query parameters to filter and sort data based on client needs.

title: Versioning REST APIs
content: API versioning helps maintain backward compatibility when introducing changes.

title: Securing API Endpoints
content: Security measures like HTTPS, tokens, and rate limiting protect APIs from abuse.

title: Testing REST APIs
content: API testing ensures endpoints behave as expected under different scenarios.
